text: Inka Pallanka (also spelled Incapallanca, Inkapallanka) is a mountain in the Andes of Peru, about high. It is situated in the Ayacucho Region, Lucanas Province, on the border of the districts of Carmen Salcedo and Pukyu. By the local people the mountain is venerated as an apu.Investigación, Universidad Nacional de San Cristóbal de Huamanga, Oficina General de Investigación e Innovación, Vol. 18 Número 2 - 2010, p. 86, Ayacucho, Peru The archaeological site of Quriwayrachina lies near Inka Pallanka. == References == Category:Mountains of Peru Category:Mountains of Ayacucho Region
title: Inka Pallanka
